name: clawbureau
description: Proof-of-harness adapters & specs — tie OpenClaw + external harnesses (Claude Code, Codex, Pi, Opencode, Factory Droid, scripts) into verifiable URM/event-chain/receipt proof bundles.

userStories.title: Proof-of-Harness Adapter Spec v1
userStories.description: As a platform engineer, I want a canonical harness adapter spec so that different runtimes emit compatible proof bundles.
acceptanceCriteria: Document URM + event-chain + receipt binding requirements
Define required harness metadata fields (id/version/config_hash/runtime)
Specify receipt binding headers (run_id/event_hash/idempotency)
Document event types + hashing rules
Spec includes examples for OpenClaw + CLI harnesses
userStories.notes: Implemented: adapter spec draft + roadmap scaffolding.

userStories.title: Proof-of-Harness schemas
userStories.description: As a verifier, I want versioned schemas for URM/event-chain/proof-bundle/attestation so that validation is deterministic.
acceptanceCriteria: Add JSON schemas for URM, event_chain, proof_bundle, execution_attestation
Register schemas in clawverify allowlist
Update schema README / index
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Implemented: added PoH payload schemas (proof_bundle, event_chain, urm, execution_attestation) + updated schema README.

userStories.title: Clawverify proof-bundle validation
userStories.description: As a marketplace, I want clawverify to validate harness proofs fail-closed so that trust tiers are reliable.
acceptanceCriteria: Validate proof_bundle payload against schema
Verify receipt envelopes with clawproxy DID
Verify event-chain hash linkage
Return trust tier based on validated components
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Implemented: payload validation aligned with PoH proof_bundle.v1 schema, cryptographic receipt verification via verifyReceipt(), event-chain hash linkage with chain_root_hash, trust tier computation.

userStories.title: Receipt binding + harness metadata
userStories.description: As a verifier, I want receipts bound to runs/harness metadata so that LLM calls are traceable.
acceptanceCriteria: Define and document standard binding headers
Attach run_id/event_hash/idempotency fields to receipts
Include harness metadata in receipt binding or proof bundle
Update clawproxy docs/skill.md
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Builds on existing X-Run-Id/X-Event-Hash support in clawproxy.

userStories.title: OpenClaw clawproxy provider plugin
userStories.description: As an OpenClaw user, I want model calls routed through clawproxy with run bindings so that receipts are automatic.
acceptanceCriteria: Provider plugin routes all model calls via clawproxy
Inject binding headers (run_id/event_hash/idempotency)
Attach receipts into run log/artifacts
Configurable base URL + token
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Implements the reference harness adapter for OpenClaw.

userStories.title: OpenClaw harness recorder
userStories.description: As a worker, I want OpenClaw to emit URM + event chain + proof bundle so that submissions are verifiable.
acceptanceCriteria: Capture tool + model events into hash-linked chain
Generate URM with harness config hash
Assemble proof bundle with receipts + event chain
Sign proof bundle with DID-work
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Recorder used by worker plugin + manual exports.

userStories.title: External harness adapters
userStories.description: As an operator, I want adapters for Claude Code/Codex/Pi/Opencode/Factory Droid so that external runs are verifiable.
acceptanceCriteria: Provide wrapper scripts for each harness
Route LLM calls through clawproxy
Emit event chain + URM + proof bundle
Publish usage docs + examples
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Wrappers should be opt-in and non-invasive.

userStories.title: clawproof SDK for API scripts
userStories.description: As a developer, I want a small SDK to emit proof bundles from scripts so that API workloads are auditable.
acceptanceCriteria: SDK records event chain + URM
SDK collects receipts via clawproxy
SDK outputs proof bundle + DID signature
Provide minimal Node.js example
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Enables integrations outside OpenClaw.

userStories.title: Canonical gateway receipts + signer allowlist
userStories.description: As a marketplace, I want clawproxy to emit canonical signed receipt envelopes and clawverify to fail-closed verify only allowlisted gateway signers so that gateway-tier proofs are non-forgeable end-to-end.
acceptanceCriteria: clawproxy returns `_receipt_envelope` as SignedEnvelope<GatewayReceiptPayload> for /v1/proxy/:provider
Receipt signer_did is did:key derived from PROXY_SIGNING_KEY public key
clawverify requires GATEWAY_RECEIPT_SIGNER_DIDS allowlist for receipt verification (fail-closed when missing)
verify/bundle, verify/batch, and verify/agent propagate allowlist into receipt verification
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Completes the end-to-end gateway tier path by making receipts verifiable and non-forgeable.
userStories.completionNotes: Implemented canonical gateway receipt envelopes in clawproxy and fail-closed signer allowlisting in clawverify.

userStories.title: Receipt binding enforcement for gateway tier
userStories.description: As a verifier, I want gateway receipts to be required to bind to the proof bundle event chain so that signature-valid receipts cannot be replayed across unrelated bundles to obtain gateway tier.
acceptanceCriteria: When verifying a proof bundle, receipts only count as verified if they are signature-valid AND have binding.run_id + binding.event_hash_b64u
binding.run_id must match the bundle event_chain run_id
binding.event_hash_b64u must reference an event_hash_b64u present in the bundle event_chain
If event_chain is missing or invalid, receipts must not count toward gateway tier (fail-closed)
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Hardens gateway-tier derivation against receipt replay by requiring binding linkage to the event chain.

userStories.title: Commit proof allowlist wiring for code bounties
userStories.description: As a marketplace, I want code bounties to verify commit proofs without DEPENDENCY_NOT_CONFIGURED so that code-based submissions can be trusted and auto-approval can run safely.
acceptanceCriteria: clawverify commit-proof verification is enabled by configuring CLAWCLAIM_REPO_CLAIM_ALLOWLIST in staging + prod
Document the expected repo_claim_id values for the initial allowlist
Provide a minimal smoke script that generates a commit_proof envelope and verifies it against /v1/verify/commit-proof
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Operational wiring + documentation so code bounties can use commit proofs with fail-closed verification.
userStories.completionNotes: Configured clawverify allowlist and added docs/smoke tooling.

userStories.title: External harness shim proxy + harness registry
userStories.description: As a platform engineer, I want external harness CLIs to produce gateway-tier PoH bundles and I want a single registry of supported harnesses so the system stays coherent as we add more runtimes.
acceptanceCriteria: External harness wrappers capture canonical _receipt_envelope receipts and inject PoH binding headers
Add a canonical harness registry file that lists supported harness IDs + connection patterns
Generate a markdown registry doc from the canonical registry
Add validation + CI checks to keep docs in sync
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Inspired by vercel-labs/skills agent registry + sync scripts; keeps our PoH harness map centralized.
userStories.completionNotes: Implemented a local shim server in clawproof-adapters + added a PoH harness registry + sync/validate scripts + CI workflow.

userStories.title: Model identity v1 (tiered) + trust vector output
userStories.description: As an enterprise platform, I want an explicit model identity object (tiered) so that closed-provider limitations are encoded and verification never over-claims weight certainty.
acceptanceCriteria: Add model_identity.v1 schema (tiered: closed_opaque|closed_provider_manifest|openweights_hashable|tee_measured)
clawproxy emits model_identity in canonical gateway receipt metadata (non-breaking)
clawverify returns a trust vector including PoH tier and model_identity_tier
Docs updated: ADAPTER_SPEC_v1 + PRDs reflect the two-axis model
userStories.notes: Phase 0: no-TEE improvements. Keep PoH tiers unchanged; add model identity as an orthogonal axis.

userStories.title: Derivation attestation v1 (Prepare analogue)
userStories.description: As a verifier, I want an attestation that a model artifact was derived from another model artifact under a declared transformation so that audits can be traced across quantization/fine-tuning.
acceptanceCriteria: Add derivation_attestation.v1 schema
Register schema in clawverify allowlist (future PR)
Add clawverify verification endpoint for derivation attestations (fail-closed) (future PR)
Optional: anchor attestation hash in clawlogs and validate inclusion proofs when present
userStories.notes: Phase 0/1. Enables A_{M→Mq}-style traceability without requiring TEEs.

userStories.title: Audit result attestation v1 (Audit analogue)
userStories.description: As a regulator-facing auditor, I want a verifiable audit result object binding model identity + audit code + dataset hashes to a result so that benchmark claims are cryptographically checkable.
acceptanceCriteria: Add audit_result_attestation.v1 schema
Define deterministic audit_pack_hash_b64u convention for policy gating (ADR 0001)
Register schema in clawverify allowlist (future PR)
Add clawverify verification endpoint for audit result attestations (fail-closed) (future PR)
Define a reference mechanism so receipts/bundles/execution attestations can attach audit_result_refs
userStories.notes: Phase 0/1. This is the main Attestable Audits delta for ClawBureau.

userStories.title: Transparency log inclusion proofs (clawlogs)
userStories.description: As a third party, I want portable inclusion proofs for clawlogs so that published attestations can be independently verified against a transparency log root.
acceptanceCriteria: Add log_inclusion_proof.v1 schema
clawlogs exposes an inclusion proof endpoint (future PR)
clawverify can validate inclusion proofs when they are supplied with attestation objects (future PR)
Docs updated: clawlogs PRD + PoH roadmap
userStories.notes: Phase 0 schema + docs; service implementation can follow.

userStories.title: WPC hooks for model identity + audit requirements
userStories.description: As a security admin, I want WPC to require minimum model identity tier and/or specific audit packs so that sensitive workflows fail closed when only opaque model identity is available.
acceptanceCriteria: Define WPC fields: minimum_model_identity_tier + required_audit_packs (by audit_pack_hash_b64u)
clawproxy enforces minimum_model_identity_tier where possible and records decisions in receipt metadata (future PR)
clawverify supports verify-under-policy semantics for receipts/bundles (future PR)
userStories.notes: Phase 0/1. Keep enforcement points explicit (proxy, runner, verifier).

userStories.title: Sandbox execution attestation hardening (clawea)
userStories.description: As an enterprise buyer, I want sandbox attestations to be specific and reproducible so that the sandbox PoH tier has concrete meaning.
acceptanceCriteria: clawea emits SignedEnvelope<execution_attestation.v1>
execution_attestation.runtime_metadata includes image digest, sandbox version, WPC binding, network posture summary, resource limits
Attestation is stored as a content-addressed artifact and anchored in clawlogs (when enabled)
userStories.notes: Phase 1. This is the bridge to a future TEE path.

userStories.title: Audit-ready export bundles (offline verifiability)
userStories.description: As an auditor, I want a single export bundle containing proof bundles, execution attestations, and inclusion proofs so that verification works offline.
acceptanceCriteria: Export includes proof bundle, execution attestation, and relevant inclusion proofs
Export is itself signed and content-addressed
clawverify can validate the export artifacts without external network calls (except optional schema fetch)
userStories.notes: Phase 1. Critical for enterprise compliance workflows.

userStories.title: TEE execution attestation (future path for openweights)
userStories.description: As a future capability, I want execution attestations that can carry TEE remote-attestation evidence so that openweights inference/audits can reach measured execution guarantees.
acceptanceCriteria: Define runtime_metadata fields for TEE evidence refs + measurements
Define allowlist + revocation strategy for TEE roots/TCB versions
Document confidentiality vs integrity trade-offs across multiple TEEs
userStories.notes: Phase 2+. Explicitly out of scope for near-term closed-provider enterprise defaults.
